pull_request.title: Windows: compile tests and examples (take II)

pullrequest.title: Windows: compile tests and examples (take II)

content.raw:
Thinking a bit more on this, we were not using the static member in the right way for the compiler to know the value in compile-time, since `this` obviously can not be resolve before running.

Instead of using `rcvStr[this->MaxRcvStr]` the option for using static would be `rcvStr[DiscoveryPrivate::MaxRcvStr]` and that, is indeed, [const at runtime](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/16/). I made the change and revert all the constexpr.
content.html:
Thinking a bit more on this, we were not using the static member in the right way for the compiler to know the value in compile-time, since this obviously can not be resolve before running.

Instead of using rcvStr[this->MaxRcvStr] the option for using static would be rcvStr[DiscoveryPrivate::MaxRcvStr] and that, is indeed, const at runtime. I made the change and revert all the constexpr.

pull_request.title: Windows: compile tests and examples (take II)

update.description:
Implemented a method for getting fork-like running on windows (it can not work with functions, just running binaries). The full thing should compile, although runtime problems still exists.

* [drone is happy](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/198) on Linux.
* [jenkins is not so happy, but compilation is fine](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-windows7-i386/76/console) on Windows.
update.title: Windows: compile tests and examples (take II)

pullrequest.title: Windows: compile tests and examples (take II)

content.html:
ummm ... I spoke too fast. The assembly code generated by clang when using const or constexpr is the same, so something is preventing the data member to be really a const in compile time.

Although my C skills really sucks, I would propose something like:

--- a/src/DiscoveryPrivate.cc   Tue Oct 21 23:13:20 2014 +0200
+++ b/src/DiscoveryPrivate.cc   Wed Oct 22 01:08:02 2014 +0200
@@ -441,7 +441,7 @@
 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
 void DiscoveryPrivate::RecvDiscoveryUpdate()
 {
-  char rcvStr[this->MaxRcvStr];
+  char * rcvStr = new char[this->MaxRcvStr];
   std::string srcAddr;
   uint16_t srcPort;
   sockaddr_in clntAddr;
@@ -464,6 +464,7 @@
   }

   this->DispatchDiscoveryMsg(srcAddr, rcvStr);
+  delete[] rcvStr;
 }

That should make clang happy.

pullrequest.title: Windows: compile tests and examples (take II)

content.raw: This is interesting. Indeed the c++11 does not have variable length arrays (vector should be that kind of structure) and it is working at all due to a [gcc extension](https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc/Variable-Length.html). I've used the c++11 constexpr in 54ae77f to workaround the problem, so the member is known at compile time and should make the compiler to be happy. code_check on trusty is clean and [drone.io](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/211) is happy. I'm happy too.
content.html: This is interesting. Indeed the c++11 does not have variable length arrays (vector should be that kind of structure) and it is working at all due to a gcc extension. I've used the c++11 constexpr in 54ae77f to workaround the problem, so the member is known at compile time and should make the compiler to be happy. code_check on trusty is clean and drone.io is happy. I'm happy too.

content.raw:
There's also a ton of integer comparison warnings:
~~~
warning: comparison of integers of different signs:
      'const unsigned long' and 'const int' [-Wsign-compare]
~~~
I fixed them in 415d71653f47 (branch win_support_testsuite_scpeters), but we could alternatively disable those types of warnings.
content.html:
There's also a ton of integer comparison warnings:

warning: comparison of integers of different signs:
      'const unsigned long' and 'const int' [-Wsign-compare]

I fixed them in 415d71653f47 (branch win_support_testsuite_scpeters), but we could alternatively disable those types of warnings.

content.raw:
Clang on osx has a couple warnings:
~~~
/Users/scpeters/ws/ignition/src/ign-transport/src/DiscoveryPrivate.cc:444:14: warning: variable length arrays are a C99 feature [-Wvla-extension]
  char rcvStr[this->MaxRcvStr];
             ^
~~~
